intro: Oreopanax xalapensis, commonly known as the Mexican arrowroot or Mexican sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by yellowish berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Oreopanax xalapensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine.
